title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.6: THIRD PARTY TECHNICAL AND MONITORING FACILITATORS

description.narrative: Third Party Monitors and Technical Facilitators, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: THE GENERAL ADMINISTRATION FOR PALESTINIAN ARAB REFUGEES
UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND WORKS AGENCY FOR PALESTINE REFUGEES IN THE NEAR EAST

sector.narrative: Field Monitoring including humanitarian performance monitoring

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Third Party Monitors and Technical Facilitators

description.narrative: The Third-Party Technical Facilitators (TPTFs) supported UNICEF staff in achieving results for children by acting as their eyes and ears in areas which cannot be easily accessed, or are fully inaccessible, by UNICEF Programme Officers. In 2021, TPTFs contributed to UNICEF accessing 40 per cent of the 2,952 communities in Syria considered to have low to medium levels of accessibility. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2022
